ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Everquest interview...
ygData.msgSnippet: Your monks must not be in PoP yet. Q ... __________________________________ Do you Yahoo!? Find out what made the Top Yahoo! Searches of 2003
ygData.messageBody:
Your monks must not be in PoP yet.

Q
--- Lorie C <mlchiello@...> wrote:
> I was not aware that pulling was taken from you.
> Please do not tell my monks. They are still happily
> pulling, and doing it well.
>
> Awulfie
>
>
> Ummmmmm, ok if you say so. I'm still paying my
> subscription so I am "dealing with it" obviously.
> My
> problem is not a small one. Bards have a role,
> monks
> do not. We can't tank. We can't harmony. We
> can't
> do melee damage like a Rogue or a Warrior. We are
> too
> stupid for trade skills (although that's what I
> spend
> most of my game time doing since groups only pick
> up
> monks as one of the "extra one or two".
>
> The idea of a monk class does rock, I agree, but
> since
> they took pulling away from us, and they took
> tanking
> away from us, all we can do is lay down and play
> dead
> and hope for a charitable group to pick us up once
> in
> a while.
>
> That's a thing.
>
> Quwi
> --- Lorie C <mlchiello@...> wrote:
> > You cannot whine about monks being nerfed. Bards
> > have been nerfed on almost every patch. Roll
> with it
> > and deal. Monks still rock.
> >
> > I would like to hear from the part of the dev
> team
> > that deals with the classes, and how the deal
> with
> > what they envision for the classes.
> >
> > And please, who coined the phrase, "Working as
> > intended." That kills me!
> >
> > Awulfie A'Mused
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Kent King
> > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > Sent: Monday, December 29, 2003 7:54 PM
> > Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Everquest
> interview...
> >
> >
> > LOL, not sure the name, but I'd love to hear
> from
> > who
> > the frock made the decision to nerf the monk
> class
> > out
> > of general usefulness. Brad? I have a
> message
> > for
> > him not suitable for minors who might read
> this
> > board,
> > but you can picture what it might be after all
> of
> > the
> > time I have invested in my monk. </em grins
> > evilly>
> >
> > Quwi Changkane Grandmaster of Fenin Ro
> >
> > --- goldleader <swany0916@...> wrote:
> > > I'm planning an interview with a developer
> or
> > > producer for
> > > Everquest. Who do you guys think would make
> an
> > > interesting interview?
> > >
> > > Any questions you'd like answered?
> > >
> > > Thanks,
> > >
> > > David
> > > VideoGameRadio.com
> > >
> > >
> >
> >
